paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

paragraphs.content: Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked; from the insurrection of the workers of iniquity:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked; from the insurrection of the workers of iniquity:

paragraphs.content: Who whet their tongue like a sword, and bend their bows to shoot their arrows, even bitter words:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who whet their tongue like a sword, and bend their bows to shoot their arrows, even bitter words:

paragraphs.content: That they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.

paragraphs.content: They encourage themselves in an evil matter: they commune of laying snares privily; they say, Who shall see them?
paragraphs.contentHtml: They encourage themselves in an evil matter: they commune of laying snares privily; they say, Who shall see them?

paragraphs.content: They search out iniquities; they accomplish a diligent search: both the inward thought of every one of them, and the heart, is deep.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They search out iniquities; they accomplish a diligent search: both the inward thought of every one of them, and the heart, is deep.

paragraphs.content: But God shall shoot at them with an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But God shall shoot at them with an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.

paragraphs.content: So they shall make their own tongue to fall upon themselves: all that see them shall flee away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So they shall make their own tongue to fall upon themselves: all that see them shall flee away.

paragraphs.content: And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of God; for they shall wisely consider of his doing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of God; for they shall wisely consider of his doing.

paragraphs.content: The righteous shall be glad in the LORD, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The righteous shall be glad in the Lord, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.
